abstract: Governments reports will include retail sales and the Consumer Price Index for June; companies reporting earnings will include Citigroup, Goldman Sachs, Intel, I.B.M., Google, Microsoft, Verizon and General Electric.
snippet: Governments reports will include retail sales and the Consumer Price Index for June; companies reporting earnings will include Citigroup, Goldman Sachs, Intel, I.B.M., Google, Microsoft, Verizon and General Electric.
lead_paragraph: ECONOMIC REPORTS The data will include retail sales for June and business inventories for May (Monday); the Consumer Price Index for June (Tuesday); housing starts for June and the Federal Reserve report on current economic conditions, known as the beige book (Wednesday); and weekly jobless claims, existing home sales for June and leading economic indicators for June (Thursday).

headline.main: Economic Reports for the Week Ahead

abstract: Jurors determined that software that lets companies manage BlackBerry devices remotely infringed Mformation’s patents.
snippet: Jurors determined that software that lets companies manage BlackBerry devices remotely infringed Mformation’s patents.
lead_paragraph: Research in Motion, the BlackBerry device maker seeking a comeback after falling behind Apple and Google in the smartphone market, has been found liable for $147.2 million in damages for infringing patents held by Mformation Technologies.

headline.main: RIM Told to Pay $147 Million in Software Patent Dispute
headline.print_headline: RIM Told to Pay $147 Million in Software Patent Dispute

abstract: Marissa Mayer, one of the top executives at Google, will be the next C.E.O. of Yahoo, making her one of the most prominent women in Silicon Valley and corporate America.
snippet: Marissa Mayer, one of the top executives at Google, will be the next C.E.O. of Yahoo, making her one of the most prominent women in Silicon Valley and corporate America.
lead_paragraph: 9:06 p.m. | Updated Marissa Mayer, one of the top executives at Google, will be the next chief of Yahoo, making her one of the most prominent women in Silicon Valley and corporate America.

headline.main: A Yahoo Search Calls Up a Chief From Google
headline.print_headline: Yahoo Search Calls Up Chief From Google

byline.original: By Andrew Ross Sorkin and Evelyn M. Rusli
